stories.title: Yes, we are shopping way more than ever

stories.text:
I'm the founder of a startup that helps to delegate work while helping the receiving party to deliver on the job in a pain-free and qualitative manner.

The product aims to solve a couple of core pain points I personally experienced myself in the past (on the sending and receiver side), but I'd love to validate and hear it from others:

What makes delegating work hard for you??

If possible, please provide a concrete example of the last time you encountered this problem. These can be about one-off examples as well as routine tasks/workflows.
stories.title: Ask HN: What makes delegating work hard?
